author: .skretch
content: With the proposer builder seperation in dank-sharding what prevents a builder from creating optimal blocks from the tx pool then just replace the transactions they want to sensor with their own tx with a higher tip resulting in them always having blocks with higher tip then the builders that only use transactions from the tx pool?

author: sky.cactus
content: Builders aren't forced to include any specific transactions.  Unless you are talking about the forced inclusion list, in which case the proposer would have to fill the block to avoid including from that which will cost them money.

author: .skretch
content: Isn't censorship a little too easy then? a  company or country could censor addresses indefinitely just by paying a little more then their specific transactions
